meanings.definition: To cut or clip (something) with scissors or shears.
meanings.sent1: Shear the paper carefully with the scissors.
meanings.sent2: I need to shear the sheep before winter.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally tried to shear the customer's ear instead of hair!
meanings.sent4: The strong wind shear tore the flag from its pole.
meanings.sent5: Shear the fabric swiftly to create a clean edge.

meanings.definition: To remove (fleece or hair) by cutting or clipping.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will shear the sheep for their wool.
meanings.sent2: She had to shear her long hair for a new style.
meanings.sent3: The sheep looked relieved after the shearing process.
meanings.sent4: The stylist will shear off the split ends to improve the hair's health.
meanings.sent5: Shear the fur gently to avoid hurting the animal.

meanings.definition: To break off or cause to break off, typically by twisting or bending.
meanings.sent1: The tree branches shear off during the storm.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally sheared the handle of the cup.
meanings.sent3: The toy's arm sheared off when the child played too roughly.
meanings.sent4: The force of the impact sheared the metal in half.
meanings.sent5: The pressure caused the bolt to shear and fall apart.
